member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Account
member.summary: Represents an account passed into the Account Manager on Glass.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Attachment
member.summary: Represents media content, such as a photo, that can be attached to a timeline item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Attachment.ContentType
member.summary: The MIME type of the attachment.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Attachment.IsProcessingContent
member.summary: Indicates that the contentUrl is not available because the attachment content is still being processed. If the caller wishes to retrieve the content, it should try again later.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.AttachmentsListResponse
member.summary: A list of Attachments. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the attachments collection.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.AttachmentsListResponse.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#attachmentsList.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Command
member.summary: A single menu command that is part of a Contact.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Command.Type
member.summary: The type of operation this command corresponds to. Allowed values are: - TAKE_A_NOTE - Shares a timeline item with the transcription of user speech from the "Take a note" voice menu command. - POST_AN_UPDATE - Shares a timeline item with the transcription of user speech from the "Post an update" voice menu command.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact
member.summary: A person or group that can be used as a creator or a contact.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.AcceptCommands
member.summary: A list of voice menu commands that a contact can handle. Glass shows up to three contacts for each voice menu command. If there are more than that, the three contacts with the highest priority are shown for that particular command.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.AcceptTypes
member.summary: A list of MIME types that a contact supports. The contact will be shown to the user if any of its acceptTypes matches any of the types of the attachments on the item. If no acceptTypes are given, the contact will be shown for all items.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.DisplayName
member.summary: The name to display for this contact.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.Id
member.summary: An ID for this contact. This is generated by the application and is treated as an opaque token.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.ImageUrls
member.summary: Set of image URLs to display for a contact. Most contacts will have a single image, but a "group" contact may include up to 8 image URLs and they will be resized and cropped into a mosaic on the client.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#contact.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.PhoneNumber
member.summary: Primary phone number for the contact. This can be a fully-qualified number, with country calling code and area code, or a local number.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.Priority
member.summary: Priority for the contact to determine ordering in a list of contacts. Contacts with higher priorities will be shown before ones with lower priorities.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.SharingFeatures
member.summary: A list of sharing features that a contact can handle. Allowed values are: - ADD_CAPTION

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.Source
member.summary: The ID of the application that created this contact. This is populated by the API

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.SpeakableName
member.summary: Name of this contact as it should be pronounced. If this contact's name must be spoken as part of a voice disambiguation menu, this name is used as the expected pronunciation. This is useful for contact names with unpronounceable characters or whose display spelling is otherwise not phonetic.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Contact.Type
member.summary: The type for this contact. This is used for sorting in UIs. Allowed values are: - INDIVIDUAL - Represents a single person. This is the default. - GROUP - Represents more than a single person.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.ContactsListResponse
member.summary: A list of Contacts representing contacts. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the contacts collection.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.ContactsListResponse.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#contacts.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Location
member.summary: A geographic location that can be associated with a timeline item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Location.Accuracy
member.summary: The accuracy of the location fix in meters.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Location.Address
member.summary: The full address of the location.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Location.DisplayName
member.summary: The name to be displayed. This may be a business name or a user-defined place, such as "Home".

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Location.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#location.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Location.TimestampRaw
member.summary: The time at which this location was captured, formatted according to RFC 3339.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.LocationsListResponse
member.summary: A list of Locations. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the locations collection.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.LocationsListResponse.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#locationsList.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuItem
member.summary: A custom menu item that can be presented to the user by a timeline item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuItem.Action
member.summary: Controls the behavior when the user picks the menu option. Allowed values are: - CUSTOM - Custom action set by the service. When the user selects this menuItem, the API triggers a notification to your callbackUrl with the userActions.type set to CUSTOM and the userActions.payload set to the ID of this menu item. This is the default value. - Built-in actions: - REPLY - Initiate a reply to the timeline item using the voice recording UI. The creator attribute must be set in the timeline item for this menu to be available. - REPLY_ALL - Same behavior as REPLY. The original timeline item's recipients will be added to the reply item. - DELETE - Delete the timeline item. - SHARE - Share the timeline item with the available contacts. - READ_ALOUD - Read the timeline item's speakableText aloud; if this field is not set, read the text field; if none of those fields are set, this menu item is ignored. - GET_MEDIA_INPUT - Allow users to provide media payloads to Glassware from a menu item (currently, only transcribed text from voice input is supported). Subscribe to notifications when users invoke this menu item to receive the timeline item ID. Retrieve the media from the timeline item in the payload property. - VOICE_CALL - Initiate a phone call using the timeline item's creator.phoneNumber attribute as recipient. - NAVIGATE - Navigate to the timeline item's location. - TOGGLE_PINNED - Toggle the isPinned state of the timeline item. - OPEN_URI - Open the payload of the menu item in the browser. - PLAY_VIDEO - Open the payload of the menu item in the Glass video player. - SEND_MESSAGE - Initiate sending a message to the timeline item's creator: - If the creator.phoneNumber is set and Glass is connected to an Android phone, the message is an SMS. - Otherwise, if the creator.email is set, the message is an email.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuItem.Id
member.summary: The ID for this menu item. This is generated by the application and is treated as an opaque token.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuItem.Payload
member.summary: A generic payload whose meaning changes depending on this MenuItem's action. - When the action is OPEN_URI, the payload is the URL of the website to view. - When the action is PLAY_VIDEO, the payload is the streaming URL of the video - When the action is GET_MEDIA_INPUT, the payload is the text transcription of a user's speech input

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuItem.RemoveWhenSelected
member.summary: If set to true on a CUSTOM menu item, that item will be removed from the menu after it is selected.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuItem.Values
member.summary: For CUSTOM items, a list of values controlling the appearance of the menu item in each of its states. A value for the DEFAULT state must be provided. If the PENDING or CONFIRMED states are missing, they will not be shown.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuValue
member.summary: A single value that is part of a MenuItem.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuValue.DisplayName
member.summary: The name to display for the menu item. If you specify this property for a built-in menu item, the default contextual voice command for that menu item is not shown.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuValue.IconUrl
member.summary: URL of an icon to display with the menu item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.MenuValue.State
member.summary: The state that this value applies to. Allowed values are: - DEFAULT - Default value shown when displayed in the menuItems list. - PENDING - Value shown when the menuItem has been selected by the user but can still be cancelled. - CONFIRMED - Value shown when the menuItem has been selected by the user and can no longer be cancelled.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Notification
member.summary: A notification delivered by the API.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Notification.Collection
member.summary: The collection that generated the notification.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Notification.ItemId
member.summary: The ID of the item that generated the notification.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Notification.Operation
member.summary: The type of operation that generated the notification.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Notification.UserActions
member.summary: A list of actions taken by the user that triggered the notification.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Notification.UserToken
member.summary: The user token provided by the service when it subscribed for notifications.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Notification.VerifyToken
member.summary: The secret verify token provided by the service when it subscribed for notifications.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.NotificationConfig
member.summary: Controls how notifications for a timeline item are presented to the user.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.NotificationConfig.DeliveryTimeRaw
member.summary: The time at which the notification should be delivered.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.NotificationConfig.Level
member.summary: Describes how important the notification is. Allowed values are: - DEFAULT - Notifications of default importance. A chime will be played to alert users.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Setting.Id
member.summary: The setting's ID. The following IDs are valid: - locale - The key to the user’s language/locale (BCP 47 identifier) that Glassware should use to render localized content.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Setting.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#setting.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Setting.Value
member.summary: The setting value, as a string.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Subscription
member.summary: A subscription to events on a collection.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Subscription.CallbackUrl
member.summary: The URL where notifications should be delivered (must start with https://).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Subscription.Collection
member.summary: The collection to subscribe to. Allowed values are: - timeline - Changes in the timeline including insertion, deletion, and updates. - locations - Location updates. - settings - Settings updates.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Subscription.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#subscription.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Subscription.Notification
member.summary: Container object for notifications. This is not populated in the Subscription resource.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Subscription.Operation
member.summary: A list of operations that should be subscribed to. An empty list indicates that all operations on the collection should be subscribed to. Allowed values are: - UPDATE - The item has been updated. - INSERT - A new item has been inserted. - DELETE - The item has been deleted. - MENU_ACTION - A custom menu item has been triggered by the user.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Subscription.UpdatedRaw
member.summary: The time at which this subscription was last modified, formatted according to RFC 3339.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Subscription.UserToken
member.summary: An opaque token sent to the subscriber in notifications so that it can determine the ID of the user.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.Subscription.VerifyToken
member.summary: A secret token sent to the subscriber in notifications so that it can verify that the notification was generated by Google.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.SubscriptionsListResponse
member.summary: A list of Subscriptions. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the subscription collection.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.SubscriptionsListResponse.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#subscriptionsList.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem
member.summary: Each item in the user's timeline is represented as a TimelineItem JSON structure, described below.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.Attachments
member.summary: A list of media attachments associated with this item. As a convenience, you can refer to attachments in your HTML payloads with the attachment or cid scheme. For example: - attachment: where attachment_index is the 0-based index of this array. - cid: where attachment_id is the ID of the attachment.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.BundleId
member.summary: The bundle ID for this item. Services can specify a bundleId to group many items together. They appear under a single top-level item on the device.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.CanonicalUrl
member.summary: A canonical URL pointing to the canonical/high quality version of the data represented by the timeline item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.CreatedRaw
member.summary: The time at which this item was created, formatted according to RFC 3339.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.Creator
member.summary: The user or group that created this item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.DisplayTimeRaw
member.summary: The time that should be displayed when this item is viewed in the timeline, formatted according to RFC 3339. This user's timeline is sorted chronologically on display time, so this will also determine where the item is displayed in the timeline. If not set by the service, the display time defaults to the updated time.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.Html
member.summary:
HTML content for this item. If both text and html are provided for an item, the html will be rendered in the timeline. Allowed HTML elements - You can use these elements in your timeline cards.
- Headers: h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 - Images: img - Lists: li, ol, ul - HTML5 semantics: article, aside, details, figure, figcaption, footer, header, nav, section, summary, time - Structural: blockquote, br, div, hr, p, span - Style: b, big, center, em, i, u, s, small, strike, strong, style, sub, sup - Tables: table, tbody, td, tfoot, th, thead, tr Blocked HTML elements: These elements and their contents are removed from HTML payloads.
- Document headers: head, title - Embeds: audio, embed, object, source, video - Frames: frame, frameset - Scripting: applet, script Other elements: Any elements that aren't listed are removed, but their contents are preserved.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.Id
member.summary: The ID of the timeline item. This is unique within a user's timeline.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.InReplyTo
member.summary: If this item was generated as a reply to another item, this field will be set to the ID of the item being replied to. This can be used to attach a reply to the appropriate conversation or post.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.IsBundleCover
member.summary:
Whether this item is a bundle cover.
If an item is marked as a bundle cover, it will be the entry point to the bundle of items that have the same bundleId as that item. It will be shown only on the main timeline — not within the opened bundle.
On the main timeline, items that are shown are: - Items that have isBundleCover set to true - Items that do not have a bundleId In a bundle sub-timeline, items that are shown are: - Items that have the bundleId in question AND isBundleCover set to false

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.IsDeleted
member.summary: When true, indicates this item is deleted, and only the ID property is set.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.IsPinned
member.summary: When true, indicates this item is pinned, which means it's grouped alongside "active" items like navigation and hangouts, on the opposite side of the home screen from historical (non-pinned) timeline items. You can allow the user to toggle the value of this property with the TOGGLE_PINNED built-in menu item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#timelineItem.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.Location
member.summary: The geographic location associated with this item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.MenuItems
member.summary: A list of menu items that will be presented to the user when this item is selected in the timeline.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.Notification
member.summary: Controls how notifications for this item are presented on the device. If this is missing, no notification will be generated.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.PinScore
member.summary: For pinned items, this determines the order in which the item is displayed in the timeline, with a higher score appearing closer to the clock. Note: setting this field is currently not supported.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.Recipients
member.summary: A list of users or groups that this item has been shared with.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.SelfLink
member.summary: A URL that can be used to retrieve this item.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.SourceItemId
member.summary: Opaque string you can use to map a timeline item to data in your own service.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.SpeakableText
member.summary:
The speakable version of the content of this item. Along with the READ_ALOUD menu item, use this field to provide text that would be clearer when read aloud, or to provide extended information to what is displayed visually on Glass.
Glassware should also specify the speakableType field, which will be spoken before this text in cases where the additional context is useful, for example when the user requests that the item be read aloud following a notification.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.SpeakableType
member.summary:
A speakable description of the type of this item. This will be announced to the user prior to reading the content of the item in cases where the additional context is useful, for example when the user requests that the item be read aloud following a notification.
This should be a short, simple noun phrase such as "Email", "Text message", or "Daily Planet News Update".
Glassware are encouraged to populate this field for every timeline item, even if the item does not contain speakableText or text so that the user can learn the type of the item without looking at the screen.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineItem.UpdatedRaw
member.summary: The time at which this item was last modified, formatted according to RFC 3339.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineListResponse
member.summary: A list of timeline items. This is the response from the server to GET requests on the timeline collection.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineListResponse.Kind
member.summary: The type of resource. This is always mirror#timeline.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.TimelineListResponse.NextPageToken
member.summary: The next page token. Provide this as the pageToken parameter in the request to retrieve the next page of results.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.UserAction
member.summary: Represents an action taken by the user that triggered a notification.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.UserAction.Payload
member.summary:
An optional payload for the action.
For actions of type CUSTOM, this is the ID of the custom menu item that was selected.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.Data.UserAction.Type
member.summary: The type of action. The value of this can be: - SHARE - the user shared an item. - REPLY - the user replied to an item. - REPLY_ALL - the user replied to all recipients of an item. - CUSTOM - the user selected a custom menu item on the timeline item. - DELETE - the user deleted the item. - PIN - the user pinned the item. - UNPIN - the user unpinned the item. - LAUNCH - the user initiated a voice command. In the future, additional types may be added. UserActions with unrecognized types should be ignored.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.MirrorService.DiscoveryVersionUsed
member.summary: The discovery version used to generate this service.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.MirrorService.Scope
member.summary: Available OAuth 2.0 scopes for use with the Google Mirror API.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.MirrorService.Scope.GlassTimeline
member.summary: View and manage your Glass timeline

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.MirrorBaseServiceRequest`1
member.summary: A base abstract class for Mirror requests.

members.member: Data format for the response. [default: json]

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.MirrorBaseServiceRequest`1.Fields
member.summary: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.MirrorBaseServiceRequest`1.Key
member.summary: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.MirrorBaseServiceRequest`1.OauthToken
member.summary: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

members.member: Returns response with indentations and line breaks. [default: true]

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.MirrorBaseServiceRequest`1.QuotaUser
member.summary: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.MirrorBaseServiceRequest`1.UserIp
member.summary: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.TimelineResource.ListRequest.OrderByEnum.DisplayTime
member.summary: Results will be ordered by displayTime (default). This is the same ordering as is used in the timeline on the device.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Mirror.v1.TimelineResource.ListRequest.OrderByEnum.WriteTime
member.summary: Results will be ordered by the time at which they were last written to the data store.
